net.jxta.ext.config
Class Profiler

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--net.jxta.ext.config.Configurator
        |
        +--net.jxta.ext.config.Profiler
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Externalizable, java.io.Serializable
public class Profiler
extends Configurator

A JXTA configurator that can autodetect and set many of its own values without user or programmer involvement.

The Profiler works exactly the same as the standard Configurator. Constructing and using the Profiler is slight different, however. Profiler only provides one constructor, which takes a peer name, such as "Brad GNUberg", and a principal name and password. When constructed, the profiler performs autodetection on this peer and does the following:

  • Enumerate all of the IP addresses for this peer, check each one for liveness (i.e. whether it is actually connected to a network), and determine whether each IP address is firewalled or NATed. We choose the "best" IP address (i.e. one that is alive and not firewalled or NATed).
  • Determine available ports on the local peer.
  • We use the above information to autoconfigure this peer as an edge peer, a rendezvous peer, or a relay peer. We also autoconfigure needed rendezvous and relay values.

After constructing a Profiler object, you can then further tailor this peer's settings based on your applications needs, and then save the resulting configurator to disk.

Current limitations:

  • Autodetection will only work if you are connected to the wider Internet and not on private LANs or WANs; this is because the firewall/NAT and liveness autodetections are based on communicating with a web-site named traceroute.org

Version:
0.1
Author:
Brad Neuberg, bkn3@columbia.edu
See Also:
Serialized Form

Field Detail

BECOME_RENDEZVOUS_PERCENTAGE

public static int BECOME_RENDEZVOUS_PERCENTAGE
The percentage chance that this peer, if it has the capabilities, will become a rendezvous peer. This value should be from 0 to 99.

BECOME_RELAY_PERCENTAGE

public static int BECOME_RELAY_PERCENTAGE
The percentage chance that this peer, if it has the capabilities, will become a relay peer. This value should be from 0 to 99.
